message.content: We refer to Mayo Clinic article on pancytopenia for help. Pancytopenia is a rare condition and can be caused by different factors, including bone marrow disorders, infections, and medication side effects. A bone marrow examination is necessary to evaluate the cause of pancytopenia. Therefore, option (A) is the best next step in evaluating this patient. Repeating CBCs may not provide much additional information, and corticosteroids or treatment for acute leukemia would not be appropriate until a definitive diagnosis is made.
